title: Jacques Derrida
summary: Jacques Derrida (/ˈdɛrɪdə/; French: [ʒak dɛʁida]; born Jackie Élie Derrida;[3] 15 July 1930 – 9 October 2004) was an Algerian-born French philosopher best known for developing a form of semiotic analysis known as deconstruction, which he analyzed in numerous texts, and developed in the context of phenomenology.[4][5][6]  He is one of the major figures associated with post-structuralism and postmodern philosophy.[7][8][9]
